content.question: Which of the following scatterplots could represent a data set with a correlation coefficient of r = -1?

choices.label: Choice A is a graph with 0 through 4 in increments of 1 on the vertical axis and 0 through 100 in increments of 20 on the horizontal axis. The points in choice A lie on a straight line with a negative slope from the upper left to lower right corners.

Choice B is a graph with 0 through 4 in increments of 1 on the vertical axis and 0 through 100 in increments of 20 on the horizontal axis. The points in choice B start in the lower left, go up to a maximum of 3 at 30, then down to a minimum of 1 at 60, then back up to another maximum of 4 at 80.

Choice C is a graph with 0 through 4 in increments of 1 on the vertical axis and 0 through 100 in increments of 20 on the horizontal axis. The points in choice C start lie on a straight line with a positive slope from the lower left to upper right corners.

Choice D is a graph with 0 through 4 in increments of 1 on the vertical axis and 0 through 100 in increments of 20 on the horizontal axis. The points in choice D are all spread out in the center of the graph between 20 and 80 on the horizontal axis and 1 and 5 on the vertical axis.
Choice E is a graph with 0 through 4 in increments of 1 on the vertical axis and 0 through 100 in increments of 20 on the horizontal axis. The points in choice E lie on a horizontal line at 2.

content.answer: Choice A is a graph with 0 through 4 in increments of 1 on the vertical axis and 0 through 100 in increments of 20 on the horizontal axis. The points in choice A lie on a straight line with a negative slope from the upper left to lower right corners.
